page.title: 19Child's average school day
page.content: The children made a survey within the school of every child's day during term time. The survey showed that most people got up at around 7.30, but some got up as early as 5.00 and some as late as 8.00. Most children enjoyed getting up. The most popular breakfast cereal was Cornflakes, some people had a cooked breakfast and some had toast. They drank either tea, coffee, fruit juice or milk. The majority of children came to school on the school bus. The remainder either came by car or walked. They came from up to a nine-mile radius around the school. The morning sessions at school are spent on maths and on language work and also the children watch a few T.V. programmes connected with their work during the week. Most children have school lunch. The rest have sandwiches
